metadata.name: Dear me
metadata.description:
Insecurities, they haunt our minds
A whisper in the dark, a voice that binds
Telling us we're not enough, not worthy of love
Filling us with doubt, a poison that's tough to shove

We compare ourselves to others, their lives seem so grand
Our own accomplishments, we fail to understand
We worry about our flaws, our imperfections
As if they define us, our greatest afflictions

We fear rejection, the sting of disapproval
So we hide our true selves, in constant removal
Of the parts of us that we deem as unworthy
Hoping that someday we'll be deserving of mercy

But insecurities, they never truly fade
No matter how hard we try, they never evade
So we must learn to accept them, to face them head-on
To love ourselves despite them, until they're gone

For in our insecurities lies a truth
That we are all flawed, in our own unique hue
And it's these imperfections that make us real
A beautiful mosaic, that time cannot steal.
